title: Boxer Rebellion
summary: The Boxer Rebellion, the Boxer Uprising or the Yihetuan Movement was an anti-foreign, anti-Christian and anti-imperialist uprising which was staged in China between 1899 and 1901, towards the end of the Qing dynasty, by the Militia United in Righteousness (Yìhéquán), known as the Boxers in English because many of its members had practised Chinese martial arts, which at the time were referred to as Chinese Boxing.
